intro: Achasma triorgyale, commonly known as the three-lobed bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant has three lobes on its leaves, which give it its scientific name. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Achasma triorgyale is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
